title: American_Top_40_1980_May_10th
description:
"Every week on American Top 40 we countdown the biggest hits in the USA from Abilene to Aberdeen, from Gillette to Marquette."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Casey tells how Mick Fleetwood, and John & Christine McVie happened to add Stevie Nicks and Lindsey Buckingham to their group Fleetwood Mac. Their song "Think About Me" is at number 37.

Actress Bernadette Peters debuts her song "Gee Whiz" at number 35.

Two listeners ask if any songs sung entirely in a foreign language have ever hit the top 40. Casey lists three that climbed all the way to number one: one in French, one in Italian, and one in Japanese.

Paul McCartney is at number 27 with "Coming Up." Casey plays the album version (the A-side), instead of the live version (the B-side).

Bob Seger & The Silver Bullet Band debut at number 26 with their song "Against The Wind" putting two songs in the countdown. The other is "Fire Lake" at number 6.

Casey says the staff at AT40 recently noticed a trend in disco hits versus ballads. So they asked the opinion of song writer/producer Freddie Perren (responsible for hits by the Sylvers, Peaches & Herb, and Gloria Gaynor). Casey reports his view of why disco is out and slow songs are back.

LW#3: Lost In Love - Air Supply
LW#2: Ride Like The Wind - Christopher Cross
LW#1: Call Me - Blondie
